sections.heading: Short title. This Act may be cited as the Illinois Workforce Innovation Board Act.
sections.text: Short title. This Act may be cited as the Illinois Workforce Innovation Board Act.

sections.heading: Plans; expenditures. The plans and decisions of the Board shall be
sections.text:
subject to
approval by the Governor. All funds received by the State pursuant to the
federal Job Training Partnership Act or the federal Workforce
Innovation and Opportunity Act shall be expended only pursuant to appropriation.

sections.heading: Programs and services, conflict of interest. In order to assure
sections.text:
objective management and oversight, the
Board shall not operate programs or provide services directly
to
eligible participants, but shall exist solely to plan, coordinate and
monitor the provisions of such programs and services.

sections.heading: Personnel. The Board is authorized to obtain the
sections.text:
services of any
professional, technical and clerical personnel that may be necessary
to carry
out its functions under this Act and under the federal Workforce
Innovation and Opportunity Act.

sections.heading: Procurement. The Illinois Workforce Innovation Board is subject to the Illinois Procurement Code, to the extent consistent with all applicable federal laws
sections.text: Procurement. The Illinois Workforce Innovation Board is subject to the Illinois Procurement Code, to the extent consistent with all applicable federal laws.

sections.heading: Audits. The Illinois Workforce Innovation Board and any recipient of
sections.text:
funds under this Act
shall be subject to audits conducted by the Auditor General with respect
to all funds appropriated for the purposes of this Act.
